Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved and spotted with light-brown granular deposit, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic west river wine-label.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 32
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393135) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393135)
